title: Baltimore County police confirm they shot Korryn Gaines' son
content:
The 5-year-old boy who was wounded during the Randallstown shootout Monday was accidentally shot by a Baltimore County Police officer, the department said Friday.
Police fatally shot the boy's mother, Korryn Gaines during an exchange of gunfire inside her apartment. Kodi Gaines was wounded, but police initially said they were investigating whether he was shot by the officer or his mother.
"As a result of an additional medical procedure performed today at Johns Hopkins Children's Center, Baltimore County Police believe that a round fired by a tactical officer struck Kodi Gaines, the 5-year-old who suffered non life-threatening injuries in Monday's police-involved shooting in Randallstown," county police said in a statement.
The boy was injured in the left cheek, police said.
Police said the officer had aimed at and struck Korryn Gaines after she had aimed her Mossberg shotgun at the officer and threatened to kill him.
Police said it would not release the name of the officer who shot Gaines, citing "an unprecedented number of threats" against its officers.
